root: ^"There's a...uh, medicinal solution I could brew, something to help your wound and ease the pain. An elixir made from the essence of..."
^"Sunflower. Those who have experienced it say it feels like being healed directly by the sun—unbelievable, I think. They must be delirious."
^The elixir glowed softly before Dr. Hyde considered it was safe to give to the afflicted youngster, who eagerly accepted it, despite his injuries.
^There was a childlike glee shining in his eyes.
^The light shone and touching the darkest corners of Hyde's heart with warmth, much like a cup of hot chocolate on a rainy day.
^"You're the kindest person ever! I owe you my life!"
^Hyde's hand reached out to ruffle the boy's hair in gentle motion.
^When the boy popped the elixir open, sniffing it for a bit and finally brought it to his lips.
^He looks up, Hyde could see his mind is whirring inside.
^With what strength left in little body, the boy rummage through his clothes and pulled out Red card, shoving it right in front of Hyde's face.
^"For the beacon. You're gonna need it. I don't want to be indebted to you."
^Dr. Hyde nodded thankfully and accept it.
^The corners of Hyde's mouth threatened to lift into a smile, but Hyde—ever the expressive one—suppressed it and chose to brush the boy's hair once more.
^Hyde made the youngster drank the entire elixir before setting out again on a journey to make amends with the universe.
